title: Alice through the looking glass PDF font
content:
Alice through the looking glass PDF font, oval dot in the "i", I think the "e" is elongated a little more than the others letters, but not sure,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701095059im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo3_4519.jpg)

Solved By: 

 [bowfinpw](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701095059/http:/typophile.com/user/2088 "View user profile.")
author: Citruxxx

comments.content:
I think this is graphically distorted, as you noted about the i-dot. It looks to me like it might be the default font (such as Adobe Serif MM) which your computer uses when you don't have the actual font installed, and it is not embedded with the PDF file.

- Mike Yanega
